intro: Pityothamnus tetramerus, commonly known as the four-rayed flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal areas. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are clustered in groups of four. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture.
